Onward & Upward üìà
Neeraj Aggarwal
Neeraj Aggarwal
   ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Verified ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Co-founder at xto10x | GM at Cure.fit | Vice President, Operations at Flipkart
Co-founder at xto10x | GM at Cure.fit | Vice President, Operations at Flipkart
2024 has been a very significant year for xto10x. In our core mission of helping companies scale more effectively, we‚Äôve taken some very meaningful steps forward this year.

- We worked with a total of 172 companies this year, with ~100 of them being first time engagements for xto10x. In total, since inception, xto10x has had the privilege of being a part of 545 companies‚Äô scaling journeys.
- Our footprint in Saudi Arabia continued to deepen across both start-ups and SMEs. This region now contributes to almost 25% of our revenue.
- Our newest (and perhaps most ambitious) program, the IPO Academy was launched recently, with the objective of helping start-ups have a very successful IPO and post-IPO journey.
- The number of employees using our HR SaaS tool, PeopleCues, for Engagement, OKRs and Performance, have almost doubled this year to 40,000.
- We expanded our footprint in non-venture funded firms. From an iconic clothing brand, to a leading publishing house, to a jewellery manufacturer‚Ä¶. we‚Äôve had amazing partnerships.

Some of the most exciting problem statements we worked on this year included:

- Growth & Marketing: Uncovering growth levers in ~15 D2C brands using our proprietary diagnostic toolkit, tripling organic traffic through a new brand campaign for an apparel brand, designing the inorganic playbook for doubling revenue for a B2B SaaS player...
- Operations: Halving operating burn for a food delivery platform, improving delivery speeds for an online marketplace helping both conversion & retention, and re-thinking the network for a Q-com player to offer 5x more SKUs in a cost-neutral manner...
- People Excellence: Re-designing Org Structure for companies, including unicorns, to de-bottleneck execution, re-structuring corporate costs to improve profitability, overhauling all people systems for an IPO bound company, programs to improve effectiveness of over 250 managers & leaders...
- Planning & Governance: Strengthening AOP planning & metrics rigor at all levels for an agri-tech platform, installing & improving OKRs leading to stronger business planning in an ed-tech firm, creating execution momentum for new business lines in a unicorn...
- Hiring: Staffing over 40 CXOs and leaders in more than 20 companies, allowing them the right leadership configuration needed.

We couldn‚Äôt be more excited about what the next year holds in store for us.

‚Ä¶more
7

Saikiran Krishnamurthy
Saikiran Krishnamurthy
   ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Verified ‚Ä¢ 3rd+
Co-founder & CEO, xto10x Technologies
Co-founder & CEO, xto10x Technologies
10mo ‚Ä¢ 
 10 months ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
Building great public market companies - IPO readiness

On Friday, we had a wonderful curtain-raiser session for theIPO academy with. Mohan had everyone spellbound for 2.5 hours (no breaks and no one moved!) - sharing the deep learnings from his years as Infosys CFO - on what it means to be truly ready to be a public company. Not just doing the IPO transaction, but being ready for the years of consistent growth and value creation that must come hand-in-hand with the responsibility of taking money from retail shareholders.

The reality is, many of us in the startup ecosystem are at the risk of missing these six simple truths ("readiness conditions") in our preparation to go public:
1. A unique ‚Äúdisruptor‚Äù business model that can outperform peers - with strong visibility into the first 8 quarters of growth/profit performance post-IPO
2. Ability to give accurate guidance and consistently deliver
3. An IPO-ready team that can scale with the business
4. An independent, highly-skilled board - as a competitive advantage
5. High transparency & 100% compliance
6. A price that leaves value on the table, ensuring great returns for both new and existing shareholders

After Mohan's talk, we did a readiness assessment with the audience of founders/CFOs on where they felt they stood on these six areas. The result was quite revealing (see attached graphic) - with board readiness coming out as the lowest scoring area. One surprise in the self-assessment for me was that consistent quarter-to-quarter performance came out quite high on the readiness score - we know from our work atthat this is something that worries many founders headed to IPO in the next 2-3 years.

The high point of the session was the manifesto signing where 80+ founders/CFOs (inspired by Mohan's words!) signed a simple statement committing to work towards true readiness before going public. We wrote this manifesto after more than 25 conversations with founders, industry stalwarts, board members, investment bankers, regulators and functional leaders who have gone public - as a simple mission statement of what we should work towards as the startup ecosystem. We will do our best asto provide operating support and act as conscience-keepers to help achieve this goal.

To read the full manifesto, please feel free to download it from(don't worry, it's not behind a paywall or registration form!). If you have IPO on your mind (who doesn't!!) and would like to discuss some of these readiness areas, please feel free to drop me a line at.

‚Ä¶more

June 11, 2023, Rajat reported directly to Abhishek
June 11, 2023,Rajatreported directly toAbhishek
I had the privilege of working closely with Abhishek at Lithium, where he served as my manager in his role as Assistant Finance Controller. Abhishek is an exceptional leader who possesses a profound understanding of finance and a keen eye for detail. Throughout our time working together, Abhishek consistently demonstrated his expertise in financial analysis, reporting, and strategy.

I have no hesitation in recommending Abhishek for any finance-related role or leadership position. He is a talented professional who consistently goes above and beyond to ensure the success of his team and organization. Any company or team would be fortunate to have Abhishek as a part of their workforce. I have no doubt that he will continue to thrive and make significant contributions wherever he goes.

I wish him all the success and prosperity for the coming years.
